title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrewbruce.himni@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: defogger
text: defog_toc_centene() first many helper functions, included differentiate Centene reporting entity (third party administrator) ’s two sub-entities, Ambetter Magellan:   Next, need download --Network (OON) -Network (INN) files.
code: # Load package library(defogger)  # Assign TiC file link to object centene_url <- "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-06-29_ambetter_index.json"  # Retrieve file with defog_get() function centene_results <- defog_toc(centene_url) |>    dplyr::slice_head(n = 10)  #----This returns a tibble of 2,598 rows so,  #----in the interest of space, we'll look at the first 10  # View first 10 rows of result centene_results #> # A tibble: 10 × 8 #>       id plan_name                plan_…¹ plan_id plan_…² entity rate_…³ locat…⁴ #>    <int> <chr>                    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   #>  1     1 "Minimum Coverage Ambet… HIOS    67138C… indivi… Cente… in_net… http:/… #>  2     1 "Minimum Coverage Ambet… HIOS    67138C… indivi… Cente… out_of… http:/… #>  3     1 "Minimum Coverage Ambet… HIOS    99110C… indivi… Cente… in_net… http:/… #>  4     1 "Minimum Coverage Ambet… HIOS    99110C… indivi… Cente… out_of… http:/… #>  5     1 "Silver 70 Ambetter EPO… HIOS    99110C… indivi… Cente… in_net… http:/… #>  6     1 "Silver 70 Ambetter EPO… HIOS    99110C… indivi… Cente… out_of… http:/… #>  7     1 "Silver 70 Ambetter PPO… HIOS    99110C… indivi… Cente… in_net… http:/… #>  8     1 "Silver 70 Ambetter PPO… HIOS    99110C… indivi… Cente… out_of… http:/… #>  9     1 "Bronze 60 Ambetter HSP… HIOS    67138C… indivi… Cente… in_net… http:/… #> 10     1 "Bronze 60 Ambetter HSP… HIOS    67138C… indivi… Cente… out_of… http:/… #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​plan_id_type, ²​plan_market_type, #> #   ³​rate_type, ⁴​location # Add reporting entity and sub-entity centene_results <- defog_toc_centene(centene_results)  # View results centene_results #> # A tibble: 10 × 10 #>       id state entity    sub_e…¹ plan_…² plan_…³ plan_id plan_…⁴ rate_…⁵ locat…⁶ #>    <int> <chr> <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   #>  1     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Minim… HIOS    67138C… indivi… in_net… http:/… #>  2     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Minim… HIOS    67138C… indivi… out_of… http:/… #>  3     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Minim… HIOS    99110C… indivi… in_net… http:/… #>  4     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Minim… HIOS    99110C… indivi… out_of… http:/… #>  5     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Silve… HIOS    99110C… indivi… in_net… http:/… #>  6     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Silve… HIOS    99110C… indivi… out_of… http:/… #>  7     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Silve… HIOS    99110C… indivi… in_net… http:/… #>  8     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Silve… HIOS    99110C… indivi… out_of… http:/… #>  9     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Bronz… HIOS    67138C… indivi… in_net… http:/… #> 10     1 CA    Centene … Ambett… "Bronz… HIOS    67138C… indivi… out_of… http:/… #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​sub_entity, ²​plan_name, ³​plan_id_type, #> #   ⁴​plan_market_type, ⁵​rate_type, ⁶​location

title: defogger
text: results , can filter out_of_network files choose state. California’s state first 10 rows ’ll go CA:   Next, plug URL object defog_oon() function retrieve file:  returns information required Transparency Coverage rule. However, simply provider’s NPI isn’t helpful analysis. practice? specialty ? part organization just individual? NPPES NPI Registry Search comes .
code: # Filter to OON California URL centene_oon_CA_url <- centene_results |>    dplyr::filter(rate_type == "out_of_network") |>    dplyr::filter(state == "CA") |>    dplyr::select(location) |>    dplyr::distinct() |>    tibble::deframe()  # View URL centene_oon_CA_url #> [1] "http://centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-06-29_centene-management-company-llc_ambetter-ca_allowed-amounts.json" # Retrieve the file centene_oon_CA_results <- defog_oon(centene_oon_CA_url) |> dplyr::slice_head(n = 10)  # View results centene_oon_CA_results #> # A tibble: 10 × 11 #>    name    billi…¹ billi…² billi…³ descr…⁴ ein   servi…⁵ billi…⁶ allow…⁷ bille…⁸ #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 ANES U… CPT     2022    00813   ANESTH… 3301… 24      profes…  1568     4655  #>  2 NFCT D… HCPCS   2022    0202U   NFCT D… 8220… 20      profes…  9586.   33925  #>  3 ANTIBO… HCPCS   2022    0224U   ANTB S… 4641… 11      profes…  1475.   10500  #>  4 NFCT D… HCPCS   2022    0225U   NFCT D… 4552… 20      profes…  8231.   47500  #>  5 PHARMA… RC      2022    250     PHARMA… 9516… 22      instit…   834.     483. #>  6 PHARMA… RC      2022    250     PHARMA… 9516… 22      instit…  1159.     219. #>  7 PHARMA… RC      2022    250     PHARMA… 9516… 22      instit…    25.6     32  #>  8 PHARMA… RC      2022    250     PHARMA… 9516… 23      instit…   834.     483. #>  9 PHARMA… RC      2022    250     PHARMA… 9516… 23      instit…  1159.     219. #> 10 PHARMA… RC      2022    250     PHARMA… 9516… 23      instit…    25.6     32  #> # … with 1 more variable: npi <chr>, and abbreviated variable names #> #   ¹​billing_code_type, ²​billing_code_type_version, ³​billing_code, #> #   ⁴​description, ⁵​service_code, ⁶​billing_class, ⁷​allowed_amount, #> #   ⁸​billed_charge

title: defogger
text: First, need isolate distinct NPIs out_of_network results unlist . 247 ’ll take first 10 keep example lightweight can:   pipe NPPES search function, defog_npi():  Next, can clean results prov_nppes_npi_clean() function:
code: # Filter to distinct NPIs and unlist centene_oon_CA_npi <- centene_oon_CA_results |>    dplyr::distinct(npi) |>    dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>    unlist(use.names = FALSE)  # View results centene_oon_CA_npi #> [1] "1104868124" "1366964330" "1760041487" "1902967557" "1710065933" centene_oon_CA_npi2 <- centene_oon_CA_npi |>    purrr::map_dfr(defog_npi)  # View results centene_oon_CA_npi2 #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   search     datetime            outcome data_lists    #>   <chr>      <dttm>              <chr>   <list>        #> 1 1104868124 2022-08-25 18:39:58 results <df [1 × 11]> #> 2 1366964330 2022-08-25 18:40:00 results <df [1 × 11]> #> 3 1760041487 2022-08-25 18:40:02 results <df [1 × 11]> #> 4 1902967557 2022-08-25 18:40:05 results <df [1 × 11]> #> 5 1710065933 2022-08-25 18:40:07 results <df [1 × 11]> # Start with base df and unnest first level start <- centene_oon_CA_npi2 |>   dplyr::filter(outcome == "results") |>   tidyr::unnest(data_lists)  # Isolate the NPI and datetime search <- start |>   dplyr::select(search:datetime) |>   dplyr::mutate(id = search) |>   dplyr::select(id, datetime)  ## || CREATE ID KEY key <- search |>   dplyr::select(id) |>   unlist(use.names = FALSE)  # Rename number & enumeration type basic_1 <- start |>   dplyr::select(     prov_type = enumeration_type,     npi = number) |>   dplyr::mutate(     npi = as.character(npi),     id = key) |>   dplyr::relocate(id)  # Basic section basic_2 <- start |>   dplyr::select(basic) |>   tidyr::unnest(basic) |>   dplyr::mutate(id = key) |>   dplyr::relocate(id)  # Join Columns basic <- dplyr::full_join(basic_1, basic_2, by = "id")  # Isolate lists lists <- start |>   dplyr::select(!(basic)) |>   dplyr::select(where(~ is.list(.x) &&    (insight::is_empty_object(.x) == FALSE))) |>    dplyr::mutate(id = key)  # Replace Empty Lists with NA lists[apply(lists, 2, function(x) lapply(x, length) == 0)] <- NA  # List names for identification ls_names <- tibble::enframe(names(lists))  #--------------- BEGIN LISTS  # Addresses section addresses <- lists |>   dplyr::select(id, addresses) |>   tidyr::unnest(cols = c(addresses))  # Join Columns #basic_add <- dplyr::full_join(basic, addresses, by = "id")  # Taxonomies taxonomies <- lists |>   dplyr::select(id, taxonomies) |>   tidyr::unnest(cols = c(taxonomies)) |>    datawizard::data_addprefix("tax_", exclude = "id")  # Join Columns #basic_add_tax <- dplyr::full_join(basic_add, taxonomies, by = "id")  # Identifiers identifiers <- lists |>   dplyr::select(id, identifiers) |>    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(identifiers)) |>    datawizard::data_addprefix("id_", exclude = "id")  # Join Columns #basic_add_tax_id <- dplyr::full_join(basic_add_tax, identifiers, by = "id")  # Practice Locations practiceLocations <- lists |>   dplyr::select(id, practiceLocations) |>    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(practiceLocations)) |>    datawizard::data_addprefix("pracloc_", exclude = "id")  # Other Names other_names <- lists |>   dplyr::select(id, other_names) |>    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(other_names)) |>    datawizard::data_addprefix("other_", exclude = "id") centene_oon_CA_npi3 <- centene_oon_CA_npi2 |>    dplyr::group_split(search) |>    purrr::map_dfr(prov_nppes_npi_clean) #> Error in as_mapper(.f, ...): object 'prov_nppes_npi_clean' not found  centene_oon_CA_npi3 #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_oon_CA_npi3' not found # View results # centene_oon_CA_npi3
